attributes.action: Stop sales of arms to Saudi Arabia until there are no human rights concerns
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia has bought 1000's of missiles and bombs in recent years and more contracts for arms have been approved. British made weapons may now be in use in the conflict in Yemen. Saudi is on the list of countries the British Foreign office thinks are of human rights concern.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS closure of the Royal Brompton hospital heart unit.
attributes.background: The Royal Brompton hospital has helped thousands of both adults and children who are born with heart problems. The unit continues to meet all NHS standards and is a leading heart unit. They helped to save my life as a child and they still look after me. They off great support and treatment

attributes.action: Make Strangles a Notifiable Disease
attributes.background: Strangles is a deadly and horrific disease in horses. Bacteria is spread through direct and indirect contact. It causes horses great distress and pain and is difficult to deal with. Outbreaks are currently managed by the common sense of horse owners but often still result in spread of the disease.
attributes.additional_details: It often happens that outbreaks are kept secret and advised biosecurity is not adhered to correctly. Horse Welfare is the biggest concern as containment procedures are optional, meaning that it often spreads and more horses suffer. The damage to the equine industry is great; entire show seasons lost, loss of livestock, and loss of income. Were it a notifiable disease anyone who had a case would not be able to keep it secret and they would have to put correct biosecurity measures in place by law.

attributes.action: Provide mental health support for all parents of premature and sick babies in UK
attributes.background:
90,253 premature and sick babies were admitted to a neonatal unit in the UK. [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit, 2014 report]
Parents of these babies are 10 times more likely to suffer post-natal depression.
41% of neonatal units have no access to trained support; 30% no support at all.
attributes.additional_details:
Little Miracles UK are campaigning to see: 

(1) Funding/resources for mental health support for all neonatal units in the UK 
(2) Mental health screening for all parents of premature and sick babies. 
(3) A trained mental health worker e.g. a counsellor, assigned to all neonatal units 
(4) After leaving hospital; care and professional support for as long as it is needed 
(5) Provision for peer-to-peer support, or similar, for these parents

attributes.action: For it to be standard, regular, practice to measure babies' heads.
attributes.background: Poppy's story! On August 25th Poppy's parents received the devastating news that she had water on the brain along with tumours. If Poppy's head had been measured they would have known it was the size of a 2 year old, having JUST turned one!
attributes.additional_details: Poppy's head was 6cm too big and had never been measured/recorded in her red book. Poppy is currently, with her parents, in HDU in Manchester Children's Hospital awaiting her fourth brain operation!

attributes.action: Accept more visas from Pakistan
attributes.background: People applying for Visa from Pakistan are being unfairly treated.  Figures obtained from UK Immigration & Visa office state that visa acceptance from Pakistan in 2015 was 46.9% & from India it was 89.2%.In 2016 up to September 30th the figure was 46.1% from Pakistan & 87% from India, highly unjust.

attributes.action: For the court to issue a consecutive sentence and not concurrent.
attributes.background: If a civil servant is assaulted doing their duties and if the person is convicted in court they should get a consecutive sentence to any other convictions and not a concurrent sentence. If that person is serving a life sentence, when granted parole it is then added past their parole date.
attributes.additional_details: Having been assaulted myself where the perpetrator was given a concurrent sentence, where this left me feeling let down by the justice system. More recently a colleague was hit 4 times with a metal pole over his back while dealing with another incident and the perpetrator was given a 4 month concurrent sentence. This is during the zero tolerance to violence which the civil service champions, but when the prisoner is given a concurrent sentence it doesn't send the message of zero tolerance.

attributes.action: The Ministry of Defence to regulate All  Forces Charities.
attributes.background:
There are far to many  Military Charities,  unchecked and uncontrolled, resulting in public donations being syphoned off,  'for Admin charges'
Bogus charities and their collection agencies, are amoral and in many cases actively  criminal.
HM Forces, Veterans and their Families deserve better.
attributes.additional_details:
The Prime Minister do, with immediate effect,  bring forward legislation,  for the Ministry of Defence to regulate All  Forces Charities. There are far to many  so called Military Charities  springing up daily,  unchecked and uncontrolled, with the result that donated money, from the supporting UK public, is being syphoned off, 'for Admin charges?'
The activities of these bogus charities and their collection agencies, are amoral and in many cases actively  criminal.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory self-defence classes into UK secondary schools
attributes.background: I propose that the UK Government introduces mandatory self-defence classes, or a self-defence programme, into the Physical Education (P.E.) part of the curriculum in secondary schools to equip children with the skills they need to defend themselves against an attacker.
attributes.additional_details: Children of today are regularly facing the threat of assault in a range of scenarios from bullying within schools to street abductions. I feel it is incredibly important to start equipping children with key self-defence skills in order to defend themselves against an attack effectively – without putting themselves in further danger. UK self-defence law should be taught as part of any self-defence classes or programmes introduced into schools; to prevent self-defence being used inappropriately.

attributes.action: Amnesty from prosecution and questioning of British Forces Veterans
attributes.background: The questioning and subsequent charging of ex service personnel, needs to stop. These serviceman and women served their country in good faith under orders and within the 'rules of engagement'. We, ex and current service personnel won't stand by and watch good men and women hanged out to dry.

attributes.action: Don't allow train companies to increase fares until they improve their service
attributes.background:
Set up an independent website where unhappy customers can log their journey disruptions easily. Train companies can't skew the figures and true results can be recorded.

If service is not kept to a high standard with trains running on time, then they are not permitted to raise their prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Train companies have announced price hikes yet again across the board. Service is worse than ever, but prices are rising. The Delay Repay scheme is nothing short of a joke.

My train was running so late that they terminated it halfway, throw all of us off so they could skip the rest of the stops and arrive on time.  That is a clear case of skewing their own statistics of how many trains arrive 'on time' - with no care for the disruption they cause their own customers.

attributes.action: Introduce longer fixed sentences for persistent serious offenders
attributes.background: Introduce longer fixed sentences for persistent serious offenders and tougher conditions and limits on their human rights whilst in prison
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was attacked by a persistent offender and very seriously injured.  She subsequently died as a result of her injuries and the psychological impact of the assault.  This offender will remain a risk to other people if he is ever released.

attributes.action: Introduce a Brain Aneurysm Awareness month to help save lives.
attributes.background: Approximately 1 in 50 people unknowingly have a brain aneurysm as most are only discovered if they rupture. This leads to an extremely dangerous condition known as a subarachnoid haemorrhage which can cause extensive brain damage. Help us raise awareness by signing. Know the facts, save a life!
attributes.additional_details:
NHS Facts
Approx 3 out of 5 people who suffer from a SAH die within 2 weeks. Half of those who survive are usually left with brain damage or disability.

http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Aneurysm/Pages/Introduction.aspx

attributes.action: Amend existing Hate Crime legislation to specifically include disabled people.
attributes.background:
Hate crimes are recorded for disabled people, however the criminal offences detailing hate crime, do not cover disabled people.
Crime & Disorder Act 1998 "Hostility on the grounds of race & religion"
Public Order Act 1986 "Stirring up hatred on the grounds of race, religion & sexual orientation"
attributes.additional_details:
Legislation needs to be clear and precise in its definition of the people targeted by hate crime and in the sentencing of those who commit hate crimes. It is a unique offence and needs to protect all those whose lives are devastated or ended through hatred. 
Disabled people cannot choose not to be disabled. 
Disabled people need the law to be amended to offer them full protection and to serve as a deterrent in sentencing those, motivated by hatred & hostility, who commit targeted offences.

attributes.action: Abolish the exemptions that MPs have received from the Investigatory Powers Act.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Act 2016 has just been passed by Parliament. It introduces further surveillance powers for UK spies. Most of the stronger powers require a warrant which can be usually issued by a secretary of state. For MPs, however, the Prime Minister must approve the warrant.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2016/25/contents/enacted

http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/news/investigatory-powers-bill-a7447781.html

attributes.action: Temporarily suspend the powers of devolution to Scotland.
attributes.background: The Scottish Government under the SNP have consistently failed to govern Scotland efficiently and effectively. Suspending devolution will allow a return to sensible and appropriate governance until such a time as a more accountable system, with suitable checks, can be established.
attributes.additional_details: Nearly every aspect of everyday life in Scotland is on the brink of disaster, from infrastructure maintenance through to the functioning of social services, health and education. Many farmers are near bankruptcy. Teachers have faced too much change without sufficient guidance, and standards in some areas have plummeted. The health service is in crisis with wards closing, waiting lists lengthening, insufficient doctors, nurses and cleaners and GP practices faltering under increased pressure.

attributes.action: Award of a National Defence Medal
attributes.background: I propose an award of a National Defence Medal to all serving and ex- serving members of HM Forces in recognition of the service that they have given/give to their country and to the people, subject to meeting certain criteria.
attributes.additional_details:
Not everyone was able to go into a war like zone but they nevertheless gave 100% effort.

Please recognise their efforts.

http://nationaldefencemedal.webs.com/Submission%20for%20the%20UK%20National%20Defence%20Medal.pdf

attributes.action: Give vegans the right to refuse funding the meat industry with their tax money
attributes.background: Veganism is the number one factor in saving the planet, resources, water shortage. Vegans are increasing every day and we feel strongly that our tax is used to fund an industry we find unacceptable. Vegans have the right as Article 9 of the EHRA states, for our views are to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: Recently the new five pound note was found to have tallow in the initial process of manufacture. This has caused outrage not just with vegan groups, the Church but also Muslims. This 'small' problem is now going to be resolved. Why then as vegans in our thousands have we not been given a choice in where our tax money goes. The meat/animal/war industries supported by a huge proportion of our earnings is entirely against our ethics. We therefore wish to question this as it is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Condemn UNESCO and suspend any Government funding
attributes.background: On 13th October 2016, UNESCO, passed a draft resolution denying Jewish connections with The Temple Mount. This resolution is inherently Anti-Semitic  We call on the Government to condemn the resolution and suspend payments to UNESCO until its charter revokes any further racist abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Jerusalem is mentioned 806 times in the Old Testament. The Temple Mount was the the site to which Abraham  took Isaac was the home to five Jewish Temples, and has been the focal point of Jewish prayers since. 
The Palestinians have a long history of abusing UN bodies in an attempt to deligitimise Jewish claims to The Holy Land. 
This latest resolution at UNESCO is not only Anti-Semitic in challenging the fundamental belief of Jews but also challenges the fundamental basis of  Christianity

attributes.action: Change the NHS 24 week revival rule
attributes.background: At the moment doctors are under no legal obligation to help any babies born before 24 weeks gestation, from what doctors have told me this is because they say babies don't have developed lungs until 24 weeks. However the earliest baby to survive was born at just 21 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: 3 years ago my son was born at just 20 weeks, he was born alive and fought for his life for 2 hours before taking his last breath. Doctors did nothing to help my baby because of the 24 week rule, and I'm sure there are hundreds of families in my situation. Like I said the earliest baby to survive was born at 21 weeks, the only reason the hospital helped her is because she lied about how far gone she was. The bottom line of a hospitals job is to keep people alive when they enter the hospital.

attributes.action: Reopen The Security Industry Authority (SIA) Contact Centre
attributes.background: As of the 6th July, The SIA have closed their contact centre in favour of a online application process. Claiming their new self-service website has been designed to provide an easier, more convenient and efficient service but has not lived up to their high expectations.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.facebook.com/thesiauk/

Multiple issues with new self-service website can be seen in the comments of The SIA Facebook page. One of the biggest complaints being unable to receive a response to any issues or queries.

attributes.action: Reconsideration of Eric Pickles' decision in 2014 to approve a SRFI in St Albans
attributes.background: In light of Greg Clark's decision in July 2016 dismissing an appeal to build a International Freight Exchange on green belt in Colnbrook, we ask the new SOS for Communities and Local Government to use Greg Clark's criteria to overturn approval for a Strategic Rail Freight Interchange in St Albans.
attributes.additional_details: After the SOS twice refused planning permission for a SRFI development on 300 acres of green belt in St Albans, Hertfordshire, Eric Pickles changed his mind and approved it in July 2014 without allowing a conjoined enquiry with Colnbrook. Greg Clark in turning down the Colnbrook development concluded "that the benefits of the scheme do not clearly overcome the harm. Consequently very special circumstances do not exist to justify the development."(on green belt)

attributes.action: Hauliers insurance policy regarding repatriation.
attributes.background: It SHOULD be part of any hauliers insurance policy that any driver, anywhere, and for any reason, be repatriated under any circumstances.  Please make it law that insurance companies do not have optional repatriation insurance, but is standard practice.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, a heavy goods driver, Paul Stephen Stanyard, passed away in Italy of natural causes.  Due to the driver being on rest/break, as required by law, the insurance company of the haulier Matthews International, refused to repatriate the driver, and Matthews International would not pay for repatriation. One can only imagine the grief that the family must be facing given the news by text message of their loved one so far away, without the additional worry of the cost of bringing him home.

attributes.action: Make driving a car using a mobile phone a disqualification offence
attributes.background: So many people killed and injured by car drivers using there phone and killing people and the offence gets 3 point on your licence. It's as dangerous as drink driving
attributes.additional_details: Every week in a newspaper you can read of a person getting killed or injured by someone using a mobile whilst driving

attributes.action: Stop importing puppies under 6 months of age into the UK.
attributes.background:
Many thousands of puppies are imported at the moment. 
The majority are bred in terrible conditions in puppy farms.
The parents live a life of misery and abuse.
Thousands of dogs are being destroyed every year.
The murder of mans best friend must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
It's estimated 40,000 puppies come from Ireland alone each year.
Some puppy farms there have a thousand bitches !Kept in terrible conditions.
Other EU countries would have even worse conditions. 
The UK can stop this cruelty by banning the importing of puppies.
The general public buy puppies from online sellers. They want young baby pups.
These are often dealers,including pet shops, who buy puppies cheaply from abroad, Many of which are sick or even dying.
They often have physiological issues !

attributes.action: Make it those with cystic fibrosis automatically transfer from DLA to pip
attributes.background: People suffering from conditions like cystic fibrosis that have qualified for DLA must currently apply for pip at 16 . This is a lifelong degenerative multi system condition requiring daily medications and physiotherapy
attributes.additional_details: Currently in the UK half of cystic fibrosis sufferers live to be over 40 . Daily medication and physiotherapy is required to help reduce mucus build up and antibiotics to prevent infections that will cause scar tissue damage to lungs . Adults with cystic fibrosis must pay for their prescription medication if they work even though not taking it would eventually result in death

attributes.action: Stop the closure of our St Leonards Community Hospital Dorset.
attributes.background: The St Leonards Community hospital was donated to the Health authority in Dorset when the Americans went back to the USA after WW2.  Local feeling is that we need this Hospital.please help to save one of our community Hospitals thank you.
attributes.additional_details:
We have worked hard for our community hospital and it is usually 98% full this helps with bed blocking here in Dorset.

http://www.stleonardsfriends.co.uk/ for more information.

attributes.action: Give legal rights to Aunties and Uncles
attributes.background: Recently my niece was taken into care but there was nothing I could do to stop that from happening because I'm just an auntie. I tried to contact the Solicitors for legal aid, but because I was just an auntie, I was told I have no rights to appeal or apply for custody. I want this changed.

attributes.action: For Parliament to ban the non-stun slaughter of animals in the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has a proud and admirable record in animal welfare.  When the RSPCA's forebearer came into existence in 1824, it was the first such body of its kind.  It is shameful that almost two centuries later we still permit the inhumane slaughter of animals based on religious grounds.
attributes.additional_details:
Both the RSPCA and the BVA are firmly of the view that animals who are not stunned before slaughter suffer.

The view of the previous Government was completely unsatisfactory and ignored widely accepted scientific evidence.  Additionally, the University of Bristol has released research indicating that many Islamic scholars agree stunned meat can remain Halal.

Regardless, it is time the United Kingdom joined Norway, Iceland, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Denmark, and Sweden in an outright ban.

attributes.action: Increase maximum sentencing for animal cruelty from 6 months.
attributes.background: The maximum penalty is 6 months’ imprisonment and/or an unlimited fine. The financial element of the penalty was raised only last year from a maximum fine of £20,000.
attributes.additional_details: For this to be discussed in parliament there must be 100 000 signatures. I recently signed the same petition but it only got to 50 000.

attributes.action: Overturn NHS decision to stop children's heart surgery at Glenfield Hospital
attributes.background: My godson's life was saved by the amazing and caring staff at this hospital, as we're many more. We should be helping these places of excellence not closing these departments!

attributes.action: End the council tax for every body
attributes.background: We want the government to End the council tax for every body and we can have more money in our pockets council tax is unlawful

attributes.action: Include cats on the reportable accident list like dogs and larger animals.
attributes.background: In less than 2 years I have had 3 cats killed after being hit by cars.  All 3 of my cats have just been left either in the road or at the side of the road and nobody has had the decency to let me know. I think it is about time that accidents involving cats should be reported as is the law with dogs.
attributes.additional_details: By letting the owner know that their beloved pet has been hit could be the difference between the cat surviving or passing away, those few minutes after an accident are crucial and could give the pet owner time to get to the vets and potentially save the cats life! I know this will not bring my cats back and it wont prevent more accidents.  But it would mean not so many people lose their pets if they can get them to the vets in time.

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the institutional bullying of carers by officialdom.
attributes.background: The institutional bullying of family carers (and those they care for) by various official bodies is now a nationally recognised phenomenon. It is known as 'mother blame' (men are also targeted). A public inquiry into this phenomenon is imperative - to address the issues and halt the practice.
attributes.additional_details:
The institutional bullying of carers (and those they care for) is a regular occurrence within local authorities, the NHS and care companies.

If carers stand up for the person they care for, or make a complaint, they are targeted; facing bullying, harassment and intimidation from those who are supposed to help and support them. Tactics employed against carers include the abuse of the MCA, MHA and safeguarding, deliberately incorrect assessments of capacity/need, general harassment and threats.

attributes.action: Increase the penalty for those involved in the puppy farm trade.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is one of the largest contributors of animal cruelty within Britain. No animal should have to go through the distress and abusive conditions that happen within this barbaric industry. Those who take part in this trade should suffer a heavy penalty for this act of cruelty.

attributes.action: Put Anglo Saxon history,  on the national curriculum for secondary schools.
attributes.background: To many people the history of our country starts with William the Conqueror.  But there is a long and colourful history before this. A history that includes the formation of our country, the laying down of laws that are still in use today and the only English king ti be given the moniker "The Great"

attributes.action: Allow Parliament a vote on planned Hinkley Point C/Bradwell nuclear power plants
attributes.background: The decision to accept the investment  from EDF and China to design, build and operate the first new ( as yet untested) nuclear power stations in a generation must be made only with the consent of parliament.
attributes.additional_details: Just a retired engineer who I believe represents the mass of public opinion

attributes.action: Make Organ Donation compulsory in the U.K. unless an individual opts out.
attributes.background:
As of 2010, 24 European countries have some form of presumed consent (opt-out) system, with the most prominent and limited opt-out systems in Spain, Austria, and Belgium yielding high donor rates.

In the United Kingdom organ donation is voluntary and no consent is presumed.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently there are over 7,000 people on the UK national transplant waiting list and, during the last financial year, over 1,300 people either died whilst on the waiting list or became too sick to receive a transplant. This is because, despite more than 500,000 people dying each year in the UK, fewer than 5,000 people die in circumstances where they can become a donor. 

If we can increase the amount of people by only 5% this will save lives each and every week in the UK.

attributes.action: Improve policies,procedures and legal requirements associated with Gas Safety
attributes.background: Although engineers must be Gas Safe registered to work on boilers and other gas appliances, the policies, procedures and legal requirements around this are so vague that people without the necessary skill and knowledge are putting peoples homes and lives at danger.
attributes.additional_details:
To ensure that only gas safe engineers are able to complete gas related works, we would like to make the following legal requirements.
- Retailers are able to sell Gas related products, parts and materials to registered engineers who show their card at the time of purchase.
- Gas Safe Engineers are required to present their card before entering a customers home when completing any gas work
- No commercial contracts made that relate to gas work without the inclusion of a gas safety registration number and copy of a gas card

attributes.action: Change the law so the councils must scan all dead pets for a microchip.
attributes.background:
Most people assume their cat would be scanned if found dead and collected by the council, and that they would be informed, but this is simply not the case. 

When a cat gets killed in a traffic accident, the councils have no legal obligation to scan for a microchip. This need to change.
attributes.additional_details:
The scanners are relatively cheap (£40) and all councils have them already to scan the stray dogs, since they are obliged to do that.

The change in law will be easy and inexpensive to implement. 
It will also save a lot of pet owners from the pain of not knowing what happened to their beloved pets.

attributes.action: Remove the Under 10m Inshore fishing vessels from the quota system.
attributes.background:
The quota system has been a nightmare for the fishing industry and fish stocks in general. The disgusting practice of throwing back good quality fish that are dead or have no chance of survival must be stopped.
Quota systems simply do not work in mixed fisheries.
attributes.additional_details:
In other countries such as Norway (that are not in the EU and bound by unmanageable rules and regulations) small inshore vessels are excluded from quota's and they have a thriving industry and healthy fish stocks.
Everybody understands the need for conservation and the quota system needs replacing with a more sustainable and environmentally friendly method such as limited days at sea and/or fishing gear restrictions. 
Throwing back dead fish is immoral and wrong and must be stopped.

attributes.action: To abolish the tv licence fee completely
attributes.background: I am trying to get the outdated tv licence fee abolished and let it get private donations like sky or virgin

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing our NHS services to outside Companies
attributes.background: I feel it is totally wrong to outsource our NHS services to private Companies, such as Richard Branson's & feel that the government is slowly beginning to privatize our National Health Service. This must not happen!

attributes.action: Help stop the suffering in Syria
attributes.background: We ask the UK Government to use its international powers to end the deliberate targeting of civilians and civilian infrastructure in Syria, negotiate access routes with Turkey and other countries which could help for medics and medical supplies to Syria.

attributes.action: Form a Select Committee on the causes of the recent rise in xenophobic behaviour
attributes.background: Police report that hate crimes have increased substantially since the EU referendum, which has been taken by some to legitimise racist & xenophobic activity. Politicians of all parties must work together to oppose this, and avoid encouraging such behaviour with careless statements and actions
attributes.additional_details: A  Select Committee should provide an opportunity for politicians to consider whether (inadvertently or not) their statements and actions have contributed to the present deplorable situation. It should also focus on exposing those elements of the media which are peddling misinformation and fostering hatred. Members of Parliament, working across party lines, should develop strategies to oppose racism and xenophobia and demand effective action from the Government.

attributes.action: Debate the cost of gluten free food and why more isn't done to help families
attributes.background:
My daughter has just been diagnosed with celiac disease and I was so surprised at the amount of money it costs just to buy simple food . And the lack of variety available 
 Also how bad the packaging is labelled informing you of the ingredients

attributes.action: petition the government to stop or at least suspend foreign aid
attributes.background: we have so many issues within the UK that we ned to re-examine whether we can afford foreign aid.
attributes.additional_details: We are struggling to maintain front line services, have people living from food banks in poverty and homelessness is on the rise. On the other hand we are spending a huge amount of money on foreign aid, giving it to countries who can afford to run a space program for example? We see on a daily basis that this money is abused - i believe this money would be better spent on issues within the UK supporting our own people.

attributes.action: Ensure Bill Of Rights affords as much protection for vegans as Human Rights Act.
attributes.background:
By protecting vegans from discrimination and bullying, the Human Rights Act makes it easier to stay vegan - indirectly reducing animal exploitation.

But leaving the EU, and replacing the Human Rights Act with a Bill Of Rights, puts such protection at risk.

More at http://veganrights.uk
attributes.additional_details:
If the UK remains a party to the European Convention on Human Rights, vegans may have to rely on foreign courts (in Strasbourg) for protection.

But if the UK also withdraws from the European Convention on Human Rights, vegans may not be protected at all.

So either way, it is vital that the Government's Bill of Rights, intended to replace the Human Rights Act, provides just as much protection.

We would also expect to see the same protection for all other groups currently protected by the Act.

attributes.action: Repeal of the Vagrancy Act of 1824.
attributes.background: This act declares it a criminal act to sleep on the streets or to beg, hence making homelessness a crime.
attributes.additional_details:
The number of cases brought to court under the 1824 Vagrancy Act has surged by 70%, prompting concerns that cuts to support services and benefits are pushing more people to resort to begging. (2009)

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2014/nov/30/begging-prosecutions-increase-england-wales

attributes.action: The law on WPA (widowed parents allowance) needs to be updated.
attributes.background: Currently those with children who are not married are not entitled to financial help with bereavement payments.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrimination of children from cohabiting couples rather than married ones is inconsistent with our human rights policy.
Please sign this petition to force the government to bring this benefit to all vulnerable families not only those with married parents.
